intro: Cheiridopsis citrina, commonly known as the yellow snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in winter. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Cheiridopsis citrina is a hardy, low-maintenance plant often cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
